headline: Former French PM Gabriel Attal wants to end surrogacy 'taboo'
description: The support he brings to the divisive issue – surrogacy is illegal in France – sets the former prime minister apart from the conservative right and the hesitations of the left.

headline: The mysteries of actress Isabelle Adjani's vocation
description: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (1/6). Nothing seemed to predestine her to become one of the greatest stars of French cinema. Yet the young actress, born to an Algerian father and a German mother, experienced a meteoric rise. She made her debut on stage at barely 17 years old and quickly transitioned to film.

headline: Being a writer in an age of digital omnipresence: James Baldwin 'seemed free in ways we sense we no longer can be'
description: 'Letters from America' (6/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams envies the great American author's bohemian, technology-free existence, despite the chaos it represented.

headline: Death of French streamer: Behind Kick, an Australian crypto casino and two young billionaires
description: The livestreaming platform began as an offshoot of one of the world's largest online gambling sites: Stake. From the outset, lax moderation was part of its DNA.

headline: In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
description: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.
